article_title: Republicans to Block Legislative Fix to Health-Care Law
article_text:
Congressional Republicans say they won’t move to preserve consumers’ health insurance tax credits if the Supreme Court strikes them down, raising the stakes in the latest legal challenge to the Affordable Care Act.

The high court is set to consider in March whether the wording of the 2010 health law means people can only get tax credits to lower their health premiums if they live in one of the handful of states running its own...

twitter.description: A Republican-controlled Congress views the possibility of the Supreme Court striking down President Obama’s health-care subsidies as the best hope to tear apart a law they long opposed.
twitter.creator: @louiseradnofsky

image.alt: GOP promises not to preserve health insurance tax credits if Supreme Court strikes them down.
